alert.note: Alert for Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 2:31PM EDT until May 09 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Barbour and Upshur. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 PM EDT, Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - As of 145 PM, the gauge at Audra was at 9.9 feet. At 10 feet, the campground in Audra State Park is flooded upstream from the river gage, and water is on the roadways in the extreme low-lying areas of the park. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Audra State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
